title: Mantra as Early Foreshadowing of Observation Haki
theoryText: The Mantra ability introduced with Enel and his priests during the Skypiea arc was deliberate foreshadowing of the Observation Haki system that would become central to One Piece. This demonstrates Oda's long-term planning, as the power system didn't come out of nowhere - it was introduced as early as Episode 155 with the priests and Enel, though it wasn't formally named 'Haki' until the Post-War Arc.
author: One Piece Community

source.title: One Piece: 10 Characters You Never Knew Possessed Haki

title: Priest Names Based on Buddhist and Hindu Concepts
theoryText: The four priests of Enel have names deliberately based on religious and spiritual concepts: Satori, Gedatsu, and Shura are all levels of reincarnation in Buddhism, while Ohm (or Om/Aum) refers to the sacred sound that signifies the essence of ultimate reality in Hinduism and Buddhism, commonly used during meditation. This naming pattern reflects Enel's god complex and the spiritual themes of the Skypiea arc.
author: Eiichiro Oda (confirmed in SBS)

title: Luffy's Possible Shandian Heritage
theoryText: A popular fan theory suggests that the Monkey D. family may have Shandian ancestry, making them descendants of Kalgara. Evidence includes: (1) Visual similarities between Kalgara's tattoos and Monkey D. Dragon, (2) Garp wearing a dog mask similar to Shandia chiefs, (3) Most notably, Luffy successfully ringing the Golden Bell (Light of Shandora), which Wyper said only his family could ring, (4) The cover of Volume 27 showing Luffy with Shandia wings. Given Oda's deliberate foreshadowing, these connections seem too specific to be coincidental.
author: Reddit One Piece Community

source.title: One Piece: Oda May Have Revealed Luffy's True Heritage That Now Makes Skypiea the Most Important Story So Far

title: Aisa's Natural Mantra as Inherited Ability
theoryText: Aisa being born with Observation Haki (Mantra) raises questions about whether this is a rare genetic trait or an inherited ability passed down through Shandian bloodlines. As the youngest known character to possess Observation Haki, her natural ability suggests that some individuals may be genetically predisposed to develop Haki, particularly within certain families or tribes. This could explain why the Shandian warriors are such formidable fighters despite living isolated from the world below.
author: One Piece Community

source.title: Why could Aisa use observation haki from birth?

title: Skypiea as Essential Setup for Endgame
theoryText: Despite being one of the most skipped arcs, Skypiea is actually essential to the One Piece endgame. The arc introduces: (1) Observation Haki through Mantra, (2) The concept of Poneglyphs and ancient history, (3) The Void Century connection through Shandora, (4) The parallel between Enel's god complex and the World Government's Celestial Dragons. Many fans theorize that the information Robin discovered in Skypiea, and the themes of oppression and liberation, will be crucial when the series' final mysteries are revealed.
author: One Piece Community

source.title: How the Most Skipped Arc In One Piece Is Secretly the Most Essential to the Story
